Title.evidence: The EMPATHY Study: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned in a 1:1 ratio

Participants.evidence: enrolled patients with elevated low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) and diabetic retinopathy

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned in a 1:1 ratio to receive intensive or standard statin therapy

Objective.evidence: The EMPATHY study evaluates whether intensive statin therapy is superior to standard therapy in reducing cardiovascular events

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was a composite of CVD incidence and CVD-related death over a maximum follow-up of 5.5 years

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, with allocation concealment ensured

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 5,144 patients were randomised (2,571 to intensive therapy and 2,573 to standard therapy)

Number_Analysed.evidence: Baseline data were analysed for 5,107 patients (2,550 in intensive and 2,557 in standard therapy) using an intention-to-treat approach

Result_Outcome.evidence: The effect size and precision of the primary outcome are reported

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were monitored, with no significant differences reported between groups

Funding.evidence: Funding sources are disclosed in the full manuscript
